|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |est_release_date = 2002 |price = 90 |upc = 760884138502 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B000062SU0 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |manuf_country = Singapore }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== [http://download.adaptec.com/pdfs//installation_guides/xhub_qsg.pdf QSG] (QSG copyright year is 2001)
From the unit populating this entry... *The P/N on the hub's label is 1935200. It is a revision C unit. *The board is shielded (differing a bit from the [[Adaptec AUH-4000 / XHub4 (1933300)|AUH-4000]]...). Besides that, the board is likely identical or near identical. "ASSEMBLED IN SINGAPORE" is visible on the unshielded portion of the board. *"CFC FREE", "FAB 1922207-00 REV B", and "PCB:CHINA" is on the back of the board. A label with "BB0C512202R" (the S/N) is also affixed to the back.
The device is presumed to use two D720110AGC hub ICs, the same controller used by the (less populated) 4-port AUH-4000.
[http://web.archive.org/web/20020602203706/http://www.everythingusb.com/hardware/index/Adaptec_XHub7+.htm Reviewed on EverythingUSB (now defunct, via archive.org)] :First appeared on the site (or at least, in the archive of the site) in 11/2011, [http://www.ntcompatible.com/news/story/adaptec_xhub7_usb_20_hub_review.html reviewed around 05/2002] [http://www.tomshardware.de/adaptec-stellt-neue-usb-2-0-hubs-vor,news-3665.html '''Adaptec Introduces New USB 2.0 Hubs''' on ''Tom's Hardware'' (DE)]
This device appears to have been shipped with a '''Deer Computer''' AD4005A power adapter (100-240VAC ~1.2A [47-63Hz] -> 5.0-5.5VDC, 6.0-5.45A).
[[Category:English Documentation]]
